markdown.markdown:
### DATAMIND

[Read our two DATAMIND reports on the use of routine data (Electronic Health Records and longitudinal studies) to study severe mental illness and cardiovascular disease risk factors.](https://datamind.org.uk/datamind-data/harmonised-data/linking-mental-and-physical-health/) They highlight the strengths and challenges of these data, complexities of defining SMI and differences in recording of SMI, and cardiovascular disease risk factors across the four nations.

### Office for Health Improvements and Disparities (OHID)

In 2023, I co-authored a report with OHID on all-cause mortality in people with severe mental illness during the COVID-19 pandemic:

[Premature mortality during COVID-19 in adults with severe mental illness](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/premature-mortality-during-covid-19-in-adults-with-severe-mental-illness/premature-mortality-during-covid-19-in-adults-with-severe-mental-illness)

## Academic publications

A full list is below, but citations can also be viewed on:

-   [Google scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=IU3FJEwAAAAJ&hl=en)
-   [UCL profile](https://profiles.ucl.ac.uk/74515-naomi-launders/publications)
-   [ORCiD](https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4241-938X)
-   [PubMed](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=launders%20N%5BAuthor%5D&sort=date)

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

library(scholar) 
library(tidyverse) 

load("files/publications.Rdata")

NEWpublications <- get_publications("IU3FJEwAAAAJ")%>%
   arrange(desc(year)) %>%
   filter(journal != "medRxiv" & journal!="OSF" & journal!="UCL (University College London)"& journal!="Available at SSRN")%>%
  filter(pubid!="IjCSPb-OGe4C" & pubid!="roLk4NBRz8UC" &pubid!="MXK_kJrjxJIC" & pubid!="KlAtU1dfN6UC" & pubid!="eQOLeE2rZwMC" & pubid!="_Qo2XoVZTnwC" & pubid!="9ZlFYXVOiuMC")%>%
   filter(!pubid %in% publications$pubid)
 
 if (dim(NEWpublications)[1] != 0) {
   NEWpublications<-NEWpublications%>%
   mutate(author_long = case_when(str_detect(author, pattern = "\\.\\.\\.$") ~ 1, TRUE ~ 0)) %>%
   mutate(author = case_when(author_long == 1 ~ (get_complete_authors("IU3FJEwAAAAJ", pubid)),TRUE ~ author))%>%
   mutate(
     author = str_replace_all(author, "([A-Z]) ([A-Z]) ", "\\1\\2 "),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "N Launders", "**N Launders**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "NJ Launders", "**NJ Launders**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "N Bryant", "**N Bryant**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "NJ Bryant", "**NJ Bryant**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "N J Bryant", "**N J Bryant**"),
     title = str_replace_all(title, ":.+", ""),
     author = str_replace(author, ", (?=[^,]*$)", ", and ")) %>%
   group_by(pubid)|>
   mutate(url = get_publication_url("IU3FJEwAAAAJ", pubid)) %>%
   ungroup()
   } else if (dim(NEWpublications)[1] == 0) {
   NEWpublications<-NEWpublications%>%
     mutate(author_long = NA, url = NA)
   NEWpublications = NEWpublications[0,]
   }
 
 publications<-rbind(NEWpublications, publications)
 
 save(publications, file = "files/publications.Rdata")
 
 publications<-publications%>%
    split(desc(.$year)) %>%
    map(function(x) {
      x <- x %>%
        mutate(
          citation = paste0(
            author,
            ". ",
            "(",
            year,
            ").",
            " ",
            "[",
            title,
            "]",
            "(",
            url,
            ")",
            ". ",
            "*",
            journal,
            "*",
            " ",
            number,
            "."
          )
        ) %>%
        select(citation)
      return(x)
    })
 
 publications <-
    map2(substring(names(publications), 2) %>% paste0("<!--", ., "-->"),
         publications,
         c) %>%
    unlist %>%
    as_tibble() %>%
    pivot_wider(names_from = value)

```

```{r results = 'asis', echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
 cat(paste0(publications), sep = "\r  \n")
```

## Non academic publications

### DATAMIND

[Read our two DATAMIND reports on the use of routine data (Electronic Health Records and longitudinal studies) to study severe mental illness and cardiovascular disease risk factors.](https://datamind.org.uk/datamind-data/harmonised-data/linking-mental-and-physical-health/) They highlight the strengths and challenges of these data, complexities of defining SMI and differences in recording of SMI, and cardiovascular disease risk factors across the four nations.

### Office for Health Improvements and Disparities (OHID)

In 2023, I co-authored a report with OHID on all-cause mortality in people with severe mental illness during the COVID-19 pandemic:

[Premature mortality during COVID-19 in adults with severe mental illness](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/premature-mortality-during-covid-19-in-adults-with-severe-mental-illness/premature-mortality-during-covid-19-in-adults-with-severe-mental-illness)

```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)

  filter(pubid!="IjCSPb-OGe4C" & pubid!="roLk4NBRz8UC" &pubid!="MXK_kJrjxJIC" & pubid!="KlAtU1dfN6UC" & pubid!="eQOLeE2rZwMC" & pubid!="_Qo2XoVZTnwC" & pubid!="9ZlFYXVOiuMC")%>%

   mutate(author_long = case_when(str_detect(author, pattern = "\\.\\.\\.$") ~ 1, TRUE ~ 0)) %>%
   mutate(author = case_when(author_long == 1 ~ (get_complete_authors("IU3FJEwAAAAJ", pubid)),TRUE ~ author))%>%
   mutate(
     author = str_replace_all(author, "([A-Z]) ([A-Z]) ", "\\1\\2 "),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "N Launders", "**N Launders**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "NJ Launders", "**NJ Launders**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "N Bryant", "**N Bryant**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "NJ Bryant", "**NJ Bryant**"),
     author = str_replace_all(author, "N J Bryant", "**N J Bryant**"),
     title = str_replace_all(title, ":.+", ""),
     author = str_replace(author, ", (?=[^,]*$)", ", and ")) %>%
   group_by(pubid)|>
   mutate(url = get_publication_url("IU3FJEwAAAAJ", pubid)) %>%
   ungroup()
   } else if (dim(NEWpublications)[1] == 0) {
   NEWpublications<-NEWpublications%>%
     mutate(author_long = NA, url = NA)
   NEWpublications = NEWpublications[0,]
   }
 
 publications<-rbind(NEWpublications, publications)
 
 save(publications, file = "files/publications.Rdata")
 
 publications<-publications%>%
    split(desc(.$year)) %>%
    map(function(x) {

        mutate(
          citation = paste0(
            author,
            ". ",

            " ",

            ")",
            ". ",

            journal,
            "*",
            " ",
            number,
            "."
          )
        ) %>%

    })
 
 publications <-
    map2(substring(names(publications), 2) %>% paste0("<!--", ., "-->"),
         publications,
         c) %>%
    unlist %>%
    as_tibble() %>%
    pivot_wider(names_from = value)
```
